metadata.title: CVE-2021-0447 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
[Unknown description]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0447` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-lowlatency - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-10.11').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
